snippet: A crucial gene on the Y chromosome, SRY, that activates male development in a human embryo is surprisingly sensitive and vulnerable to environmental factors, a study finds.
abstract: Study in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds that SRY gene on Y chromosome, gene responsible for activating male development, is highly vulnerable to environmental factors, leading to wide divergence of testosterone-related male attributes from man to man.
lead_paragraph: A crucial gene on the Y chromosome, SRY, that activates male development in a human embryo is surprisingly sensitive and vulnerable to environmental factors, a study finds.

headline.print_headline: Genetics: Male Sensitivity Written in the Genes
headline.main: Male Sensitivity Written in the Genes

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
